page.title: 13LINKS MARKET
page.content: The Links Market started in 1305 as a trading market. At that time it was called the Spring Fair. It was held on the links along what is now the Esplanade. People from all over came to buy and sell their goods. The Links Market now is the biggest street market in Europe. There are very few trading stalls now and it is purely for fun. There are about 60 large machines such as the meteorite and speedway; about 150 stalls and about 30 roundabouts for children under five. The Market is about one mile long on both sides of the Esplanade. The hobby horses, about 80 years old, are the oldest roundabout: they were renovated a year ago. Most popular among young people are the big machines. About 100,000 people come during the six days it is in Kirkcaldy
